resources.string:
"FakeStandby requires this functionality to make it possible to control every screen and every app. This feature will only used to provide the functionality of the app and will not access, save, collect or share any of the data.
Warning: If you have the "Start standby on boot" option enabled, your screen will get dark after enabling this. Press the power button and wait a few seconds to escape this."
"A required service for FakeStandby is not running. Please restart your device."

"The app is not permitted to display overlays over other apps. In order to run the app you need to grant the "Display over other apps" permission for FakeStandby. The permission makes it possible for the app to display content over the content of other apps. To grant the permission enable the switch on the following screen."

"Some option for FakeStandby is not enabled in the accessibility settings of your device. To run the app that service has to be enabled. Simply open the accessibility settings, scroll down to FakeStandby and enable it. On some devices you may look for the option under "installed services""
"Tap on the screen with 4 or more touches at the same time"
"Choose the methods that can be used to escape the fake standby state"
"No close method set for the fake standby"
"The app is currently not available in your native language? Help translating it to help it go around the world!"
"See the licensing information of the app."
"Visit GitHub to see all the source code of this app."
When enabled, the fake standby will be started as soon as the accessibility service is started. For example after boot.
